lyrics: Let us pause in life's pleasures
and count its many tears
While we all sup sorrow with the poor
There's a song that will
linger forever in our ears
Oh Hard times come again no more
Tis the song, the sigh of the weary
Hard times, hard times, come again no more
Many days must we labor,
to reach that distant shore
Oh hard times come again no more
While we seek mirth and beauty
and music bright and gay
There are frail forms fainting at the door
Though their voices are silent,
their pleading looks will say
Oh hard times come again no more
Tis the song, the sigh of the weary
Hard times, hard times, come again no more
Many days must we labor,
to reach that distant shore
Oh hard times come again no more
Tis a sigh that is wafted
across the troubled wave
Tis a wail that is heard upon the shore
Tis a dirge that is murmured
around the lowly grave
Oh hard times come again no more
Tis the song, the sigh of the weary
Hard times, hard times, come again no more
Many days must we labor,
to reach that distant shore
Oh hard times come again no more
Oh hard times come again no more
